instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3126: What is 820-3126? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Just the first led
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this imac motherboard don't start, the first led is green when i press power (when the imac i complete), the led1 shutdonw.
I try to change the power supply but same problem.
I plug just the power supply and button ON, the led2 don't light when i push the on button, but the led1 stay on.
i measure 
<SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H_ACDC</SIGNAL>=12,05V
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_PS</SIGNAL>=0V normal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Just the first led
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_PS</SIGNAL>=0V is ok because this will come high when computer is fully on (S0 stage)

I bet you have USB ports burned.......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Just the first led
threads.message: There is a short somewhere. As soon as you power it on it pulls down the power supply. Measure all rails for shorts to GND.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Just the first led
threads.message:
Hi,
i don't find any short on all rails
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> = 0,35Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0,75Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0</SIGNAL> = 8,9Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> = 18ohm ???
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> = 80ohm ???
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 4,4Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> > 4Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> = 95ohm
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 2,2Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 2,4Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H</SIGNAL> 9,1Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_T29</SIGNAL> 12Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_T29</SIGNAL> 16ohm
<SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0</SIGNAL> 4kohm
<SIGNAL>PPVTT_S0_DDR</SIGNAL> 2,8K
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 9ohm
<SIGNAL>PPVAXG_S0</SIGNAL> 19,5ohm
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_PCH</SIGNAL> 18ohm
Do you have any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Just the first led
threads.message: There must be a short somewhere. Video card, USB port? Only thing I can tell you that there must be a short somewhere pulling the PSU down. You could inject 12V on <SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL> and monitor current draw.
